                v1.4.3
              </span>
            </a>
            <a class="select-menu-item js-navigation-item js-navigation-open "
              href="/jarro2783/cxxopts/tree/v1.4.2/README.md"

  <div id="readme" class="readme blob instapaper_body">
    <article class="markdown-body entry-content" itemprop="text"><p><a href="https://travis-ci.org/jarro2783/cxxopts" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/b2cb47ad5ae5fa75daf6481d02a4cae7d031a3e7/68747470733a2f2f7472617669732d63692e6f72672f6a6172726f323738332f6378786f7074732e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572" alt="Build Status" data-canonical-src="https://travis-ci.org/jarro2783/cxxopts.svg?branch=master" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<h1><a href="#quick-start" aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" id="user-content-quick-start"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Quick start</h1>
<p>This is a lightweight C++ option parser library, supporting the standard GNU
style syntax for options.</p>
<p>Options can be given as:</p>
<pre><code>--long
--long=argument
--long argument
-a
-ab
-abc argument
</code></pre>
<p>where c takes an argument, but a and b do not.</p>
<p>Additionally, anything after <code>--</code> will be parsed as a positional argument.</p>
<h2><a href="#basics" aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" id="user-content-basics"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Basics</h2>
<pre><code>#include &lt;cxxopts.hpp&gt;
</code></pre>
<p>Create a cxxopts::Options instance.</p>
<pre><code>cxxopts::Options options("MyProgram", "One line description of MyProgram");
</code></pre>
<p>Then use <code>add_options</code>.</p>
<pre><code>options.add_options()
  ("d,debug", "Enable debugging")
  ("f,file", "File name", cxxopts::value&lt;std::string&gt;())
  ;
</code></pre>
<p>Options are declared with a long and an optional short option. A description
must be provided. The third argument is the value, if omitted it is boolean.
Any type can be given as long as it can be parsed, with operator&gt;&gt;.</p>
<p>To parse the command line do:</p>
<pre><code>auto result = options.parse(argc, argv);
</code></pre>
<p>To retrieve an option use <code>result.count("option")</code> to get the number of times
it appeared, and</p>
<pre><code>result["opt"].as&lt;type&gt;()
</code></pre>
<p>to get its value. If "opt" doesn't exist, or isn't of the right type, then an
exception will be thrown.</p>
<p>Note that the result of <code>options.parse</code> should only be used as long as the
<code>options</code> object that created it is in scope.</p>
<h2><a href="#help-groups" aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" id="user-content-help-groups"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Help groups</h2>
<p>Options can be placed into groups for the purposes of displaying help messages.
To place options in a group, pass the group as a string to <code>add_options</code>. Then,
when displaying the help, pass the groups that you would like displayed as a
vector to the <code>help</code> function.</p>
<h2><a href="#positional-arguments" aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" id="user-content-positional-arguments"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Positional Arguments</h2>
<p>Positional arguments can be optionally parsed into one or more options.
To set up positional arguments, call</p>
<pre><code>options.parse_positional({"first", "second", "last"})
</code></pre>
<p>where "last" should be the name of an option with a container type, and the
others should have a single value.</p>
<h2><a href="#default-and-implicit-values" aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" id="user-content-default-and-implicit-values"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Default and implicit values</h2>
<p>An option can be declared with a default or an implicit value, or both.</p>
<p>A default value is the value that an option takes when it is not specified
on the command line. The following specifies a default value for an option:</p>
<pre><code>cxxopts::value&lt;std::string&gt;()-&gt;default_value("value")
</code></pre>
<p>An implicit value is the value that an option takes when it is given on the
command line without an argument. The following specifies an implicit value:</p>
<pre><code>cxxopts::value&lt;std::string&gt;()-&gt;implicit_value("implicit")
</code></pre>
<p>If an option had both, then not specifying it would give the value <code>"value"</code>,
writing it on the command line as <code>--option</code> would give the value <code>"implicit"</code>,
and writing <code>--option=another</code> would give it the value <code>"another"</code>.</p>
<p>Note that the default and implicit value is always stored as a string,
regardless of the type that you want to store it in. It will be parsed as
though it was given on the command line.</p>
<h2><a href="#boolean-values" aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" id="user-content-boolean-values"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Boolean values</h2>
<p>Boolean options have a default implicit value of <code>"true"</code>, which can be
overridden. The effect is that writing <code>-o</code> by itself will set option <code>o</code> to
<code>true</code>. However, they can also be written with various strings using either
<code>=value</code> or the next argument.</p>
<h2><a href="#custom-help" aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" id="user-content-custom-help"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Custom help</h2>
<p>The string after the program name on the first line of the help can be
completely replaced by calling <code>options.custom_help</code>. Note that you might
also want to override the positional help by calling <code>options.positional_help</code>.</p>
<h1><a href="#linking" aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" id="user-content-linking"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Linking</h1>
<p>This is a header only library.</p>
<h1><a href="#requirements" aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" id="user-content-requirements"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Requirements</h1>
<p>The only build requirement is a C++ compiler that supports C++11 regular
expressions. For example GCC &gt;= 4.9 or clang with libc++.</p>
